page.description: Applications that need to adapt to varying screen sizes or orientations can use either adaptive design, responsive design, or a combination. Adaptive designs determine the size and orientation of a device, and present a different interface depending on the device. Responsive designs change the shape and positioning of controls on the device using a single interface that in which the controls (text fields, buttons, images, etc) can move to new positions and change size. Both approaches are discussed below.

section.title: Adaptive Design
section.description: Alpha Anywhere can automatically detect the type of device on which the application is running and then launch the best interface for that device. This is done with the AppLauncher component, and is documented in [this blog article and video].

section.title: Responsive Design
